question: How did being laid off affect your sense of control?
responses: , a lot of anxiety about finances, especial with both earners unemployed., aucunement, badly, didn't, i knew it was coming. i just thought i would have something lined up already, but it didn't happen., expected it since it's low season for tourism. qualified for ei so i didn't feel too stressed., giving control never feels good, hopeless, horrible, i didn't have much of that to begin with, but i certainly had less after., i feel a lot less certain about my future. i still have control over myself and my future but there are additional barriers to get to where i want to be., i feel betrayed by my employer., i feel it has allowed me to take more control of what i want to do next., i feel like i've lost a lot of control and don't exactly how to get it back, i felt esterely stressed about not having an income., i knew it was coming because it was a contract with a specific end date. so i wouldn't say it affected my sense of control in particular., i was very stressed out and directionless due to being let go, i had moved out for the job so at that point i was just living in this unfamiliar town where i had no job and had no idea what to do next., i worked in lytton, the town was burnt in late june, that was traumatic, i've been laid off before and i was able to bounce back because of contacts and reputation, but i now can't get an interview because they say i should be retired., increasedfrustration and leaving me starved for creative outlet i can physically accommodate, it didnt really, as i already knew upfront that the job was temporary & would eventually end. i felt good knowing that i worked full time for 6 months & then was able to add another great reference to my resume. so i felt actually fully in control upon leaving., it sucks. and it's hard to feel in control when i've been applying for jobs i'm over qualified for and they keep telling me they love me but i don't have enough experience/is normally be perfect for the job but in this current market a lot of former professors/phds are applying to these starting positions with 10 years of experience. starting to feel like a lie, it was a relief. i felt more in control of my time. it was a ver poorly run company., less income meant less control., lost all control, lost all sense of control, felt useless, lowered self esteem, made me angry that one person with an attitude slammed door on low people on totem pole yet gets to keep his job. and is the shining face of the company but slashes people behind the scenes., made me feel way more in control of my life. i get laid off every winter and i can't wait to get laid off every year. it allows me to take back my life and work on things i actually want to do. it also allows me to pursue other income streams and work on self improvement and training., none, none. this is my typical seasonal close. normally i have a contract position waiting for me for over the winter. that business went under last year so i am currently looking for a winter gig., not at all., not good, not much after the initially shock wore off., seasonal, had no control, terribly as income was crippled, when you are laid off at my age you figure you will never work again, was relieved because job was too stressful for me., yes, hard to articulate, had health issues shortly afterwards which curtailed all activities for a few months.... therefore, the health issue rather than the loss of work affected me more., hurt, no, well, was lost in what i would do. searching through jobs and finding something that paid better than minimum wage is always a loss of control., wondered how to pay the bills

question: Other (specify) response for: What was the main reason why you stopped working at that job?
responses: , business sold, permanently furloughed., company wasn't safe, contracted covid in january and have been struggling with long-covid ever since, covid 19 politically motivated mandates destroyed the ability to do my job in person and do it with small business clients that struggled, end of contract, exhausting to try to work and do childcare, fired for not getting a covid vaccine, i did not terminate my employment.i am on a medical leave from my job (unrelated to covid)., illness i got long covid, it was a co-op position in my master's program., j'ai quitte mon emploi pour voyager, maternity leave, my main employer decided to protect the ft staff and all the pt staff were furloughed!!! no benefits-no choice at all - pt staff were to be kept on call when ft staff became sick or didn't show up. very disgusted, sad, and upset with this., new boss came on- mangled my job of almost 20 yrs. boss's former employee expressed interest in working with her again, so boss hired her and a big part of my job went to her former employee to justify it being full time. was let go., on unpaid leave of absence for no vaccination, paternity leave, but have been suspended for not not taking the injection ordered by dear leader, permanent disability from previous workplace injury, rotations ended, sabbatical, sabbatical vacation, school, the company has lost some big clients, and as a result, they reorganized to right size for the business they have left., the company weren't taking covid seriously, toxic job environment, underpaid, work related injury, abc, business purchased, covi longue, end of the fishing season., fin du stage, i had my business stolen from me when covid hit and my trainer of my horse stable stoled my entire business, old age catching up to me. now take on smaller lighter work., took an unpaid leave of absence, travail saisonnier

question: Other reason (specify) response for: What was the main reason that you retired?
responses: , bullting by my supervisine vice principal and isolated by him from union help, covid caused health issues dud ti stress of having employees stop working, conflict with colleagues at work., constructively dismissed - employer settled my labour board claim, covid came along and i wanted to limit my exposure to the general public., covid reduced the number of students so classes were cancelled, covid, i live with and volunteer time with seniors, i got an a payout to leave and retire, i was retired and worked part time to spice up my income, moved in with financee and to a remote area where no work was to be found., mental health, metrolinx moved my office further away making the commute undesirable, moved due to wife"s job, moved so we could afford to live, my age and that covid is around and didn't want to go back into office after working at home for so long. also a torn meniscus so walking was difficult., not just one reason, age, turned 70, took care of a dying relative, wanted to take care of grandchildren, had adequate income, one of thousands of healthcare workers forced out by covid vaccine mandates. now i'm a sahm and homeschooler., our union gave up the right to negotiate on the members behalf which made it easier to be denied medical disability., plant closure, sold property, spouse died and as we operated as a team it was impossible to operate without him, technically retired, but now a blogger with wide social media presence as a major hobby (non profit)., the schools had closed due to covid, it was during that time that i decided to retire, however, my previous employer has asked me if i wish to return to work. i am currently busy with my dad who is in acute care at the moment. i may change my mind in the future., to join spouse overseas, we own a home in mexico, so we decided to be snowbirds, we were transferred with my wife's job and i couldn't find employment, plus i turned 65 this september, work related accident, closed during covid, j ai travaille jusqu a 80 ans comme professeur et je peins encore, lourdeur de la pandemie et collegue incompetent, my husband doesn't want me to work outside the home, not able to wear mask for 8 hours a day

responses: , business not taking pandemic seriously, i chose not to return for several reasons 1) my clientele drooped off failed to return in fear of catching the virus or found alternative means of service 2) my own personal health having issues that could be triggered or comprised if i was to catch the virus 3) in my household there is my mother-in-law who not only is a heart patient she is 83 years of age i did not want to bring home the virus to her or if i id bring it home there is no way to self isolate in our present home setting 4) it came to my appent attention the injury and pain i had suffered from 37 years of working in the hair industry so not returning was i guess you could say a reward to myself for all the years of had physical work i put in 4) if i had gone back to work my home life would have become so unbearably uncomfortable in house settings meaning my wife has taken this virus very serious and arrangements would have had to occur that were uncomfortable for me " happy wife happy life ", i think these questions are coming up because i said i was unemployed. because it didnt' give me a homemaker options., j'ai deja ecrit, je suis en reorientation de carriere, lack of respect for my personal time (working at home meant no downtime, not even on weekends) and lack of regard for my safety during the pandemic (coworkers do not practice social distancing and i was forced to come in, toward the end)., moving, moving to a different continent., my working holiday visa expired and i was no longer able to work as i switched to a tourist visa, they were asking me to work too fast., to take care of a loved one., covid and over working the housekeeping staff, faire autre chose, got hurt in the line of duty
